newsitem.title: ITALY: Olivetti H196 pre-tax loss 440.2 bln lire.
newsitem.headline: Olivetti H196 pre-tax loss 440.2 bln lire.

text.p: Italian information technology group Olivetti said in a statement it made a pre-tax loss for the first half of 1996 of 440.2 billion lire.
This figure was reached after absorbing the negative result of its 41 percent owned cellular phone operation Omnitel of 90 billion lire.
Olivetti said its operating loss was 80.8 billion lire in the same period.

Olivetti said its board also approved a 200 billion lire provision against possible charges stemming from divestments and restructuring "deriving from the decision of the company to accelerate the reduction of its presence in the hardware sector."
The company said net consolidated sales were 4.224 trillion lire against 4.738 trillion in 1995 although it said the figures were not comparable.
Olivetti said it made a net loss of 147.9 billion lire in the first half of 1996.
Its net debt at the end of the first half of 1996 was 1.261 trillion lire. This compared with 764.8 billion at December 31, 1995.

Olivetti gave no comparisons but the company made a net consolidated loss of 1.598 trillion lire in the whole of 1995, with a consolidated operating profit of 114 billion on turnover of 9.84 trillion.
